snippet: Lapses of security were negligible compared with errors that let terrorists thrive.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Ethan Chorin, former Foreign Service officer in Libya, argues that diplomatic security lapses that led to fatal 2012 attack on embassy in Benghazi are negligible when compared to flawed reasoning behind American military intervention there; holds that United States underestimated regional importance of Libya, and that lack of plan for reconstruction and reconciliation has fostered an environment in which terrorists can thrive.
lead_paragraph: Lapses of security were negligible compared with errors that let terrorists thrive.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
